Standard_Text: Identify, analyze, and synthesize relevant external resources to pose or solve problems (Measured in PT only)
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Identify important quantities in a practical situation and map their relationship (e.g.using diagrams, two way tables, graphs, flowcharts, or formulas)
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Analyze the adequacy of and make improvements to an existing model or develop a mathematical model of a real phenomenon.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Interpret results in the context of a situation
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: State logical assumptions being used.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Construct, autonomously, chains of reasoning to justify mathematical models used, interpretations made, and solutions proposed for a complex problem.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Apply mathematics to solve problems arising in everyday life, society, and the workplace.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Students can analyze complex, real-world scenarios and can construct and use mathematical models to interpret and solve problems.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: At later grades, determine conditions under which an argument does and does not apply. (For example, area increases with perimeter for squares, but not for all plane figures.)
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Base arguments on concrete referents such as objects, drawings, diagrams, or actions.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Distinguish correct logic or reasoning from that which is flawed, and if there is a flaw in the argument, explain what it is.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Use the technique of breaking an argument into cases.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: State logical assumptions being used.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Construct, autonomously, chains of reasoning that will justify or refute propositions or conjectures.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Test propositions or conjectures with specific examples.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Students can clearly and precisely construct viable arguments to support their own reasoning and to critique the reasoning of others
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Identify important quantities in a practical situation and map their relationship (e.g., using diagrams, two way tables, graphs, flowcharts, or formulas).
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Interpret results in the context of a situation.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Select and use appropriate tools strategically.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Apply mathematics to solve well-posed problems arising in everyday life, society, and the workplace.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Students can solve a range of complex well-posed problems in pure and applied mathematics, making productive use of knowledge and problem solving strategies.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Summarize, represent, and interpret data on a single count or measurement variable
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Define trigonometric ratios and solve problems involving right triangles
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Build a function that models a relationship between two quantities
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Analyze functions using different representations
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Interpret functions that arise in applications in terms of a context
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Understand the concept of a function and use function notation
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Represent and solve equations and inequalities graphically
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Solve equations and inequalities in one variable
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Understanding solving equations as a process of reasoning and explain the reasoning (rational & radical)
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Create equations that describe numbers or relationships
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Perform arithmetic operations on polynomials
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Write expressions in equivalent form to solve problems
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Interpret the structure of expressions
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Reason quantitatively and use units to solve problems
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Use properties of rational and irrational numbers
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Extend the properties of exponents to rational exponents
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)

Standard_Text: Students can explain and apply mathematical concepts and interpret and carry out mathematical procedures with precision and fluency.
Subject: CAASPP/SBAC Assessment (2018-)
